result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnoldo Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(3)(b)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
to commence forthwith 
with Huber priv's

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnoldo Diaz

records.addlTxt:
01:30 P
Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defendant sentenced to  12 months in the KCJ w/huber priv's, forthwith;
213 days sentence credit given.
Court costs waived; no restitution requested.
Submit to DNA sample and pay the surcharge; surcharge due in 60 days or civil judgment.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. 
Appeal rights given

09:50 AM
Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court, defendant not in court, in custody.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.
Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
No Record.
PSI order was not prepared.
Sentencing hearing rescheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:35 PM Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared by phone means and in-custody.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Defendant Arnoldo Diaz.
Prosecuting Atty Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Sherry Bauer.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Def. unable to appear in person due to covid outbreak in the jai.
Defendant admits to prior convictions and entered a plea of Guilty to Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Info, Repeater;
Found guilty by the court.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice mailed to def. in jail.
Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared by phone means and in-custody.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Defendant Arnoldo Diaz.  Prosecuting Atty Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Matter resolved, set over for plea &sent.
Bond cont'd.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

01:27 PM
Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz; Defendant in-custody.
Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:35 AM
Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared by phone means and in-custody.
Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz appeared in court for the Defendant.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.
  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, just rec'd offer and needs time to discuss w/def.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:47 PM
Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court, defendant not in court, in custody.
Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Arguments heard on the motion.
Bond motion is denied for reasons stated on the record.
Next hrg:  PTC 3/15/2022 at 8:30 am.
Bond Motion set for 2/24/2022 at 1:45 pm.
Defendant's NMM to Modify Bond filed by Benjamin L. Schwarz.

Defendant Arnoldo Diaz appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jazmin Itzel Ramirez Bailon appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
